intro: Cynanchica pulvinaris, commonly known as the purple milkvetch, is a perennial leguminous plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from purple to pink. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and is adapted to survive in dry environments through deep root systems. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in restoration projects. The plant is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in challenging soil conditions.
